C．hate&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．Protect<br />\r\n<strong>III.</strong><strong>阅读理解（共</strong><strong>20</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>40</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n第一节 (共15小题；每小题2分，满分30分)阅读下列短文，从每题所给的四个选项(A、B、C和D)中，选出最佳选项。<br />\r\n<strong>A</strong><br />\r\nAn Australian&shy;based scientist announced yesterday he had made a step forward in forensic (用于法庭的) DNA testing so that an individual can be identified by a single cell.<br />\r\nIan Findlay，from the Australian Genome Research Facility at the University of Queensland，said current DNA testing required 200 to 500 cells to gain a similar level of accuracy. &ldquo;What we have done has brought that down to one cell，&rdquo; Dr. Findlay said&nbsp; after releasing details of his DNA testing technique at a Sydney conference.<br />\r\nThe technology could allow investigators to pick up DNA identifies from plastic cards and even build up a complete history of the people who have handled a paper document.<br />\r\n&ldquo;You&rsquo;d have to wear a space suit to stop yourself from leaving traces. You can identify cells on the paper，so you can work out where it came from and who touched it，&rdquo; he said.<br />\r\nThe technique could also be used to trace the thrower of a punch from cells left behind on the skin of their victim. Even the wearing of latex gloves would not help：small cells can pass through the gloves，and the constant flow of genetic material given off by the human body would leave further evidence.<br />\r\n&ldquo;We gained a skin cell from a document dating back 30 years and managed to gain a DNA fingerprint. DNA evidence can remain fresh for decades，perhaps even centuries，&rdquo; Dr. Findlay said. &ldquo;The potential for this technology to solve unsolved crimes is great，&rdquo; he added.<br />\r\nBut Dr. Findlay，named scientist of the year in 1998 by the European Society of Human Genetics，said the new testing needed to be scientifically <u>validated</u>，which would take up to five years.<br />\r\nHe said，&ldquo;There are serious consequences taking on technologies too early. The public has to be sure that they have the utmost confidence in the security and court systems.&rdquo;<br />\r\n36．The main advantage of the new technology is that_______________________.<br />\r\nA．a single cell can identify an individual<br />\r\nB．it has brought down the cost of DNA testing<br />\r\nC．a higher level of accuracy can be acquired with a single cell<br />\r\nD．it needs less than 200 cells to gain a certain level of accuracy<br />\r\n37．The underlined word &ldquo;validated&rdquo; in the seventh paragraph means________.<br />\r\nA&nbsp; confirmed&nbsp; B．imagined&nbsp;&nbsp; C．supposed&nbsp;&nbsp; D．criticized<br />\r\n38．According to Ian Findlay，the new technology can_____________.<br />\r\nA．help to keep DNA evidence fresh for decades and even centuries<br />\r\nB．make the process of DNA testing much more simplified<br />\r\nC．help to pick up DNA identities more easily<br />\r\nD．be widely used in five years at most<br />\r\n39．The last paragraph suggests that________.<br />\r\nA．the immediate adopting of the technology may cause mistakes<br />\r\nB．the public have acknowledged the new testing technology<br />\r\nC．it is safe to put the new technology into use now<br />\r\nD．Dr.Findlay is quite sure of his new technology<br />\r\nB<br />\r\nEdmund Jackson, who is 83 years old now, was injured as a gunner in World War Ⅱ on August 7, 1944. The 20&shy;year&shy;old jumped out of the plane and spent 32 days hiding from the enemies in Yugoslavia. The history in Jackson&rsquo;s head and the stories of other veterans (退伍军人) are being collected and will be put in a new series of schoolbooks by the American Veterans Institute. The American Veterans Institute hopes to give the books to schools to get students from three&shy;year&shy;old to seventh grade more interested in history by offering stories with places, dates and facts.<br />\r\n&ldquo;I wouldn&rsquo;t want to go through it again, but I wouldn&rsquo;t have missed it for anything，&rdquo; Jackson said. &ldquo;It&rsquo;s important for them to know there are people willing to die for their country.&rdquo;<br />\r\nThe American Veterans Institute, which is based in Tipp City, aims to help people appreciate military(军事的) service more. Tara Dixon Engel, co&shy;founder，said&nbsp; the American Veterans Institute started the book project in 2006 because many students didn&rsquo;t seem to know who veterans are and what they did. The group has spent as much as $25,000 on the program and has finished writing three books so far. For some books, the group plans to use written stories from veterans of the Revolutionary War (独立战争)and oral histories from the World War Ⅱ Victory Museum in Auburn, Ind. Once the books come out, the institute and the Victory Museum will give them to schools for free.<br />\r\n40．Why does the writer mention Edmund Jackson in the first paragraph?<br />\r\nA．To tell us his stories during World War Ⅱ.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．To tell us for whom the books are written.<br />\r\nC．To lead to the topic of the passage.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．To advise us not to forget veterans.<br />\r\n41．The purpose of the American Veterans Institute&rsquo;s project is to ________.<br />\r\nA．help people know soldiers better&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．help people appreciate military service more<br />\r\nC．offer children more interesting books&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．collect stories of veterans<br />\r\n42．All of the following statements are true EXCEPT that ________.<br />\r\nA．Edmund Jackson was a gunner in World War Ⅱ<br />\r\nB．the stories have places, dates and facts<br />\r\nC．three books have been finished writing<br />\r\nD．all the stories are about veterans of World War Ⅱ<br />\r\n43．What do we learn about the American Veterans Institute?<br />\r\nA．It was founded by Tara Dixon Engel alone.<br />\r\nB．It just publishes(出版) books for school students.<br />\r\nC．It has spent more than thirty thousand dollars on the program.<br />\r\nD．It will give all the books to schools for free.<br />\r\n<strong>C</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; Among various programs, TV talk shows have covered every inch of space on daytime television. And anyone who watches them regularly knows that each one is different in style(风格). But no two shows are more opposite in content, while at the same time standing out above the rest, than the Jerry Springer and the Oprah Winfrey shows.<br />\r\nJerry Springer could easily be considered the king of &ldquo;rubbish talk&rdquo;. The contents on his show are as surprising as can be. For example, the show takes the ever-common talk show titles of love, sex, cheating, and hate, to a different level. Clearly, the Jerry Springer show is about the dark side of society, yet people are willing to eat up the troubles of other people&rsquo;s lives.<br />\r\nLike Jerry Springer, Oprah Winfrey takes TV talk show to its top. But Oprah goes in the opposite direction. The show is mainly about the improvement of society and different quality(质量) of life. Contents are from teaching your children lessons, managing your work week, to getting to know your neighbors.<br />\r\nCompared to Oprah, the Jerry Springer show looks like poisonous waste being poured into society. Jerry ends every show with a &ldquo;final word&rdquo;. He makes a small speech about the entire idea of the show. Hopefully, this is the part where most people will learn something very valuable.<br />\r\nClean as it is, the Oprah show is not for everyone. The show&rsquo;s main viewers are middleclass Americans. Most of these people have the time, money, and ability to deal with life&rsquo;s tough problems. Jerry Springer, on the other hand, has more of a connection with the young adults of society. These are 18-to-21-year-olds whose main troubles in life include love, relationship, sex, money and drug. They are the ones who see some value and lessons to be learned through the show&rsquo;s exploitation.<br />\r\n44. Compared with other TV talk shows, both the Jerry Springer and the Oprah Winfrey are ____.<br />\r\nA. more interesting&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. unusually popular&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. more detailed&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. more formal<br />\r\n45. Though the social problems Jerry Springer talks about appear unpleasant, people who watch the shows____.<br />\r\nA. remain interested in them&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. are ready to face up to them<br />\r\nC. remain cold to them&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. are willing to get away from them<br />\r\n46 Which of the following is likely to be a topic of the Oprah Winfrey show?<br />\r\nA. A new type of robot.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. Nation hatred.<br />\r\nC. Family income planning.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Street accident.<br />\r\n47. We can learn from the passage that the two talk shows_____.<br />\r\nA. have become the only ones of its kind&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. exploit the weaknesses in human nature<br />\r\nC. appear at different times of the day&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. attract different people<br />\r\n<strong>D</strong><br />\r\nThere are two types of people in the world. Although they have equal degree of health and wealth and other comforts of life, one becomes happy and the other becomes unhappy. This arises from the different ways in which they consider things, persons, events and the resulting effects upon their minds.<br />\r\nPeople who are to be happy fix their attention on the convenience of things: the pleasant parts of conversation, the well prepared dishes, the goodness of the wine and the fine weather. They enjoy all the cheerful things. Those who are to be unhappy think and speak only of the opposite things. Therefore, they are continually dissatisfied. By their remarks, they sour the pleasure of society, offend(hurt) many people, and make themselves disagreeable everywhere. If this turn of mind was founded in nature, such unhappy persons would be the more to be pitied. The intention of criticizing(批评) and being disliked is perhaps taken up by imitation(模仿). It grows into a habit, unknown to its possessors. The habit may be strong, but it may be cured when those who have it realize its bad effects on their interests and tastes. I hope this little warning may be of service to them, and help them change this habit.<br />\r\nAlthough in fact it is chiefly an act of the imagination, it has serious results in life since it brings on deep sorrow and bad luck. Those people offend many others; nobody loves them, and no one treats them with more than the most common politeness and respect. This frequently puts them in bad temper and draws them into arguments. If they aim at getting some advantages in social position or fortune, nobody wishes them success. Nor will anyone start a step or speak a word to favor their hopes. If they bring on themselves public objections, no one will defend or excuse them, and many will join to criticize their wrongdoings. These should change this bad habit and be pleased with what is pleasing, without worrying needlessly about themselves and others. If they do not, it will be good for others to avoid any contact(接触) with them. Otherwise, it can be disagreeable and sometimes very inconvenient, especially when one becomes mixed up in their quarrels.<br />\r\n48. People who are unhappy _______.<br />\r\nA. always consider things differently from others<br />\r\nB. usually are affected by the results of certain things<br />\r\nC. usually misunderstand what others think or say<br />\r\nD. always discover the unpleasant side of certain things<br />\r\n49. We can conclude from the passage that _______.<br />\r\nA. we should pity all such unhappy people &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. such unhappy people are dangerous to social life<br />\r\nC. people can get rid of the habit of unhappiness<br />\r\nD. unhappy people can not understand happy persons<br />\r\n50. In this passage, the writer mainly _______.<br />\r\nA. describes two types of people&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. laughs at the unhappy people<br />\r\nC. suggests the unhappy people should get rid of the habits of unhappiness<br />\r\nD. tells people how to be happy in life<br />\r\n第二节 信息匹配 （共 5小题 ，每小题 2分，满分10分）<br />\r\n(广州市2012届高三年级调研测试英语试题) 请阅读下列学位申请者的信息，从A、B、C、D、E和F A reward of $500 is offered for the car&rsquo;s recovery.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>II</strong><strong>卷</strong><strong>(</strong><strong>共</strong><strong>35</strong><strong>分</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>IV.</strong><strong>短文改错（共</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>1</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;假定英语课上老师要求同桌之间交换修改作文，请你修改你同桌写的以下作文。文中共有10处语言错误，每句中最多有两处。错误涉及一个单词的增加、删除或修改。<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp; 增加：在缺词处加一个漏词符号（&and;），并在其下面写出该加的词。<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp; 删除：把多余的词用斜线（﹨）划掉。<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp; 修改：在错的词下划一横线（___），并在该词下面写出修改的词。<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp; 注意:1. 每处错误及修改均仅限一词；<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2. 只允许修改10处，多者（从第11处起）不计分。<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nAs summer vacation are coming soon, my classmates are trying very<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nhardly to get train tickets to go home. But I have made up my minds to spend<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nthe vacation far from home for first time in my life. My parents have agreed to<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nvisiting me, and I will have a different vacation. When they came here, I will<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nshow them around my university and the city just as well. I have decided to buy<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nthem some nice gifts. It will be a big surprising for them. My parents had done<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\na lot for me, and I think it is high time that I did anything special to express my<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nthanks.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nV.书面表达（满分25分）<br />\r\n书面表达（满分10分）<br />\r\n假如你们学校&ldquo;英语爱好者俱乐部&rdquo;将对&ldquo;良好饮食习惯&rdquo;这一话题进行讨论。请根据下列提示，用英语写一篇发言稿。内容要点应包括：</span><br />\r\n<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\">\r\n	<tbody>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">部分同学的饮食习惯</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;良好的饮食习惯</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 144px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">个人看法</span></td>\r\n		</tr>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">不吃早餐<br />\r\n				爱吃零食<br />\r\n				偏食<br />\r\n				饮食过量&nbsp;</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">饮食多样化<br />\r\n				饮食定时定量&nbsp;</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 144px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">有助于身体健康<br />\r\n				&hellip;&hellip;</span></td>\r\n		</tr>\r\n	</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">注意：1. 发言稿必须包括所有内容要点，可适当发挥；<br />\r\n2. 发言稿开头与结尾已为你写好，不计入总词数;<br />\r\n3. 词数：100左右；<br />\r\n4. 参考词汇: 偏食：be particular about food 零食：snack<br />\r\n<em>Dear friends, </em><br />\r\n<em>As we all know, we are what we eat. A. only&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. almost&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C. never&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. nearly<br />\r\n19. A. advice&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. experience&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C. quality&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. service<br />\r\n20. A. care&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. serve&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;C. like&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. know<br />\r\n<strong>III.</strong><strong>阅读理解</strong> <strong>（共</strong><strong>20</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>40</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n第一节 (共15小题；每小题2分，满分30分)阅读下列短文，从每题所给的四个选项(A、B、C和D)中，选出最佳选项。<br />\r\n<strong>A</strong><br />\r\nTime flies! It&rsquo;s an&lsquo; old saying，but in today&rsquo;s fast-paced world, it&rsquo;s never been so true. Before we know it, our kids are all grown up&mdash;out on their own or off to college. Most parents realize the rewards of close family ties. Yet the demands of jobs and day-to-day household activities can be stressful and tiring. So it&rsquo;s easy for quality time with our kids to get squeezed out.<br />\r\nYou won&rsquo;t want to find yourself looking back, amazed realizing you missed something special. More importantly, spending time with your child gives you a chance to shape his values. As your child gets you can provide a good frame of reference as he is exposed to the growing influence of peers and popular culture. The more time you spend with your child, the more you will be able to help him know about his abilities, skill-building activities, and healthy friendships.<br />\r\nOK, but does your child want to spend time with you? As kids get older, they begin to declare their independence. But studies show that most youth like spending time with their parents. So if you set fair rules and give your child the freedom that&rsquo;s right for his age, you most likely will be able to enjoy each other&rsquo;s company.<br />\r\nTime set aside works well&mdash;family dinner hours, home-work time, shopping, trips, or a game in the evening. Still, finding real &ldquo;quality&rdquo; time can be tough. So take advantage of that one-on-one time that just happens as you are cooking, caring for a pet, riding in the car, or raking leaves.<br />\r\nWhat is quality time? Quality time means communicating in an upbeat (无与伦比的) and useful way&mdash;watching TV in silence doesn&rsquo;t count. Talking with children is one of the best things you can do to help them grow up happily and |healthily.<br />\r\n36. According to the second paragraph, a child who spends little time with his parents______.<br />\r\nA. can grow up more independently<br />\r\nB. has more freedom to choose his peers<br />\r\nC. may be wrongly influenced by popular culture<br />\r\nD. is better at knowing about his own abilities&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n37. Studies show that when kids grow up, they________.<br />\r\nA. will not want to talk with their parents<br />\r\nB. can still enjoy their parents&rsquo; company<br />\r\nC. care more about independence and freedom<br />\r\nD. don&rsquo;t like their parents&rsquo; company any more<br />\r\n38. We can learn from the passage that_________.<br />\r\nA. parents today have more time to talk with their kids<br />\r\nB. getting kids involved in daily housework can do good to them<br />\r\nC. it&rsquo;s not easy for parents to find time to talk with their kids today<br />\r\nD. it is beneficial to talk with kids while watching TV&rsquo;<br />\r\n39. What is the main point the author wants lo stress in the passage?<br />\r\nA. How to communicate with kid.<br />\r\nB. How to raise confident kids.<br />\r\nC. The rewards of close family ties.<br />\r\nD. The importance of spending time with kids.<br />\r\nB<br />\r\nSome people think they need to change how they look or act to feel good about themselves. But actually all you need to do is to change the way you see your body and how you think about yourself.<br />\r\nThe first thing to do is to recognize that your body is your own，no matter what shape, size，or color it comes in. If you are very worried about your weight or size，check with your doctor to verify(核实)that things are OK. But it is no one&rsquo;s business but your own what your body is like- in the end，you have to be happy with yourself.<br />\r\nNext，identify which aspects of your appearance you can realistically change and which you can&rsquo;t. Everyone，even the most perfect-seeming celebrity, has things about themselves that they can&rsquo;t change and need to accept-like their height，or shoe size.<br />\r\nIf there are things about yourself that you want to change and can，do this by making goals for yourself. For example; if you want to get fit, make a plan to exercise every day and eat nutritious foods. Then keep track of your Progress until you reach your goal. Meeting a challenge you set for yourself is a great way to boost self-esteem(自尊).<br />\r\nWhen you hear negative comments coming from within Yourself, tell yourself to stop: Try building your self-esteem by giving yourself three compliments(称赞)every day. While you&rsquo;re at it，every evening list three things in your day that really gave you pleasure. It can be anything from the way the sun felt on your face，the sound of your favorite band, or the way someone laughed at your jokes. By focusing on the good things you do and the positive aspects of your life，you can change how you feel about yourself.<br />\r\n40.What is the passage mainly about?<br />\r\nA. How to change what your body is like.<br />\r\nB. How to make realistic goals for yourself.<br />\r\nC. How to improve your body image and self-esteem.<br />\r\nD. How to give yourself compliments.<br />\r\n41. No matter what your body is like，_______.<br />\r\nA. You have to be happy with yourself<br />\r\nB. you must change your appearance<br />\r\nC. you should make a plan to exercise every day<br />\r\nD. you have to change how you feel about yourself<br />\r\n42. The underlined word&ldquo;boost&rdquo;in the fourth paragraph probably means&ldquo;______&rdquo;.<br />\r\nA. discourage&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. maintain&nbsp;&nbsp; C. increase D. protect<br />\r\n43. If you think highly of yourself at the bottom of your heart，you will _______.<br />\r\nA. get fit and become perfect<br />\r\nB. focus on the negative aspects of your life<br />\r\nC. get more positive comments<br />\r\nD. build up your self-esteem sooner or later<br />\r\nC<br />\r\nEarth Day is meant to inspire an awareness and appreciation for the vulnerability(脆弱)of this planet we call home. It is the day designated(指定)to emphasize the fact that we all have a responsibility to the environment and need to correct our personal behavior to improve the quality of our air, earth and water.<br />\r\nGlobal awareness of the need to protect the environment has grown obviously since 20 million people in the United States marked the first Earth Day on April 22, 1970. That environmental teach-in v/as staged in protest(^tij) at the US government&rsquo;s response to the destruction caused by an oil spill (^tH) along the coast of Southern California. For 10 days in January1969,a damaged Union Oil platform spilt up to 100 000 barrels of crude oil into the ocean, polluting coastal communities, killing marine (MW^) life and about 10 000 birds. |<br />\r\nThe incident was a wake-up call for the need to protect the well-being of the Earth. But similar disasters have continued to happen. Designating one day to the Earth&rsquo;s wellbeing is clearly more than necessary.<br />\r\nChina is struggling to lead the way to economic growth driven by renewable (可再生的) energy. The government is spending billions to explore energy alternatives such as wind, solar, nuclear and tidal power. China is also committed to constructing a &ldquo;resource-conserving and environment-tally friendly society&rdquo;. The 12<sup>th</sup> Five-Year-Plan（2011-2015) set targets that will guide the country&rsquo;s response to climate change. It also puts forward an &ldquo;ecological security&rdquo; strategy.<br />\r\nHowever, these efforts need to be matched by individuals in this country. A new study found a wide gap in China between people&rsquo;s claimed and actual sustainable behavior. According to the study, many people view solving environmental problems as the role of government, rather than a personal responsibility.<br />\r\nApparently we don&rsquo;t think that reusing grocery bags and recycling water bottles can control today&rsquo;s serious threats to the quality of our air, land and water. This is an easy place to start to make a difference when we celebrate Earth Day.<br />\r\n44. The oil spill mentioned in the passage______.<br />\r\nA. caused great damage to the Union Oil<br />\r\nB. happened on April 22, 1970<br />\r\nC. killed about 100 000 birds<br />\r\nD. caused serious pollution<br />\r\n45. What does the fourth paragraph mainly talk about?<br />\r\nA. China&rsquo;s methods for achieving economic growth.<br />\r\nB. How to explore energy alternatives.<br />\r\nC. China&rsquo;s efforts to protect the well-being of the Earth.<br />\r\nD. How to respond to climate change.<br />\r\n46. There is a wide gap in China between people&rsquo;s claimed and actual sustainable behavior because______.<br />\r\nA. many individuals don&rsquo;t have the ability to pay efforts<br />\r\nB. many people don&rsquo;t think their efforts can make a difference<br />\r\nC. reusing grocery bags cannot control today&rsquo;s serious problems<br />\r\nD. many people think solving environmental problems is not their business<br />\r\n47. What does the author suggest in the last paragraph?<br />\r\nA. We should help protect the environment.<br />\r\nB. We should reuse all the grocery bags.<br />\r\nC. We should look for new ways to celebrate Earth Day.<br />\r\nD. We should control these serious threats right now.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\nD<br />\r\nToday we explain more popular proverbs (谚语). A proverb is a short, well-known saying that expresses a common truth or belief. Proverbs are popular around the world.<br />\r\nMany listeners have sent us their favorite proverbs. They give advice about how to live. We begin with two popular proverbs about staying healthy by eating good food. One is &ldquo;An apple a day keeps the doctor away. &ldquo;The other is &ldquo;You are what you eat. &ldquo;<br />\r\nSeveral proverbs about birds also give advice. You may have heard this one: The early bird catches the worm. This means a person who gets up early or acts quickly has the best chance of success. Another famous proverb is &ldquo;A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. &ldquo; This means you should not risk losing something you have by seeking something that is not guaranteed<br />\r\nAnother proverb warns &ldquo;Do not put all your eggs in one basket. &ldquo;This means you should not put all of your resources together in one place because you could risk losing everything at one time. Many Americans learned this the hard way by investing all their money in stock shares, which then lost value. Another proverb says &ldquo;A fool and his money are soon parted. &ldquo;This n\\ea^^ someone who acts unwisely with money will lose it.<br />\r\nDo you agree with the proverb that &ldquo;Children should be seen and not heard&rdquo;? Maybe you have told your children that &ldquo;Hard work never hurt anyone. &ldquo;But other people say that &ldquo;All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. &ldquo;They believe it is not wise to spend all your time working and never having fun.<br />\r\nFinally, here is one of our favorite proverbs: People who live in glass houses should not throw stones. This means you should not criticize other people unless you are perfect yourself.<br />\r\n48. The proverb &ldquo;You are what you eat&rdquo; advises us to_______.<br />\r\nA. eat an apple a day&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. have a healthy diet&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nC. live a happy life&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. put all the eggs in one basket<br />\r\n49. Which of the following proverbs can we use to persuade someone slow in action?<br />\r\nA. A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush<br />\r\nB. All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy<br />\r\nC The early bird catches the worm.<br />\r\nD. A fool and his money are soon parted.<br />\r\n50. People are advised not to invest all their money in stock shares because______.<br />\r\nA. they may risk losing it at one time<br />\r\nB. it is no use putting all the resources together<br />\r\nC. they may get cheated after the investment<br />\r\nD. it is difficult to earn money in stock shares<br />\r\n<strong>第二节：阅读下面的短文并从方框中的</strong><strong> A-F </strong><strong>中为每段文字选出最佳标题。</strong><br />\r\n下面文章中有5处需要添加小标题。请从以下选项（A、B、C、D、E、F）中选出符合各段意思的小标题，并在答题纸上将相应的选项标号涂黑。选项中有一项是多余选项。<br />\r\nA. The spreading tea&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. The history of tea growing<br />\r\nC. Changes of tastes for drinks &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Reducing cancer risks<br />\r\nE. The plant Camellia Sinensis&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F. A woman&rsquo;s opinion of tea<br />\r\n51. _______________<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Americans are far more knowledgeable about drinks than they were 20 years ago. Witness the Starbucks revolution and you&rsquo;ll know where the trend goes. Now, encouraged by recent studies suggesting that it can cut the risk of cancer and heart disease and slow the aging process, tea is enjoying a similar change. Enough fashionable tea houses are springing up to make even longtime coffee drinkers consider switching drinks.<br />\r\n52. _______________<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tea is available in more places than ever. The Tea Association of the United States reports that from 1990 to 1999, annual sales of the drink grew to $ 4.6 billion from $ 1.8 billion. &ldquo;Green tea is seen by consumers as a &ldquo;functional food&rdquo; ---- delivering health benefits beyond food itself, says Vierhile.<br />\r\n53. _______________<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Recently published studies point out that only teas that come from the leaves of the plant Camellia Sinensis have been shown to contain health benefits. Other herbal teas may taste good, yet they do little more than warm up the drinker. But for Camellia Sinensis, the evidence is powerful. In a 1998 study, Harvard University researchers found that drinking one cup of black tea a day lowered the risk of heart attack by as much as 44 percent compared with non-tea drinkers, and others studies have suggested that the antioxidants(抗氧化剂) in these so-called real teas can also prevent cancer.<br />\r\n54. _______________<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; One such antioxidant in green tea is ECGC, a compound 20 times as powerful as vitamin E and 200 times as powerful as vitamin C. &ldquo;When people ask me for something good and cheap they can do to reduce their cancer risk, I tell them to drink real tea,&rdquo; says Mitchell Gaynor, director of medical oncology at New York City&rsquo;s Strange-Cornell Cancer Prevention Center.<br />\r\n55. _______________<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Among those inspired to become a green tea drinker is Tess Ghilaga, a New York writer who took it up after seeking advice from a nutritionist six years ago. &ldquo;I&rsquo;ve never been a coffee drinker,&rdquo; says Ghilaga, 33. &ldquo;She told me to start drinking green tea for the antioxidant qualities.&rdquo; Now Ghilaga and her husband habitually make tea ---- they order theirs from InPursuitof Tea.com, an Internet tea company. And although tea contains about half the amount of caffeine in a cup of coffee, &ldquo;you still get such a kick from it,&rdquo; says Ghilaga.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>II</strong><strong>卷</strong><strong>(</strong><strong>共</strong><strong>35</strong><strong>分</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>IV.</strong><strong>任务型读写（共</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>1</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\nThere are a number of languages spoken throughout the world. Every person knows at least one language, which he learns in his childhood and is routinely used for speaking and writing. However, many people are fond of learning two or more languages, so they try to be bilingual, which means that they try to have the knowledge of two or more languages. And being bilingual can bring a person a number of benefits in various aspects. For example:<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A person can get cognitive(认知的) benefits from it. The bilingual people have two or more words for each idea and object. Therefore, a bilingual person can develop a creative thinking. The bilinguals are aware of which language should be spoken with which person in a particular situation. So they are more sensitive(敏感的) to the needs of the listener than the people who only use one language: Being bilingual also improves and enriches a person&#39;s mental development.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Being bilingual has a positive effect on a person&#39;s character. The bilinguals are able to switch between different languages and talk to different people in various languages. It increases a sense of self-esteem( 自尊). Being bilingual creates a powerful link in different people from different countries.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A bilingual education offers better curriculum results. The bilinguals tend to show a higher performance in examinations and tests. The bilinguals find it quite easy to learn and speak three, four or more languages.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Being bilingual offers potential employment benefits. It offers a wider choice of jobs in various fields. The bilinguals can get a great many career opportunities in transport, tourism, public relations, marketing and sales, banking, translation, law, teaching and so on.<br />\r\nSo it can be concluded from the above that we should try our best to learn and master two or more languages.<br />\r\nTitle: 1.__________ of being bilingual</span><br />\r\n<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\">\r\n	<tbody>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 84px; I&rsquo;m sure the beauty of_____ .nature there will make ______ excellent impression on you.<br />\r\nA. the; the&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. the; an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C./;an&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D./;/<br />\r\n2.(2012 福建泉州一中模拟)We all feel it is Jack as well as his wife that _____for their son&rsquo; s bad performance at school.<br />\r\nA. are to blame&nbsp;&nbsp; B. is to be blamed&nbsp;&nbsp; C. are to be blamed&nbsp;&nbsp; D. is to blame<br />\r\n3. Many young people in the west are expected to leave ______ could be life&rsquo;s most important decision-marriage-almost entirely up to luck.<br />\r\nA as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. that&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. which&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. what<br />\r\n<strong>II.</strong><strong>完形填空（共</strong><strong>20</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>1.5</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>30</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n(2011浙江高考) Although I love my life, it hasn&rsquo;t been a lot of fun as I&rsquo;ve been ill for 28 years.<br />\r\nMusic has always been a great love of mine and, in my 20s, when my <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;16&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;was more manageable, I <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;17&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;ten years as a professional singer in restaurants, playing and singing folk songs. <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;18&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>that was years ago and times have changed. <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;19&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;I live with mother on a country farm.<br />\r\nTwo years ago, I decided that I would need to have some kind of extra work to <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;20&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;my disability pension (残疾抚恤金). <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;21&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;I needed to sleep in the afternoons,&nbsp; I was limited in my <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;22&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>. I decided that I would consider <u>&nbsp;23&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;to singing in restaurants.<br />\r\nMy family are all musicians, so I was <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;24 </u>&nbsp;when I went into our local music store. I explained that I wanted to sing again but using recorded karaoke music. I knew that discs were very expensive and I really didn&rsquo;t have a lot of&nbsp; <u>&nbsp;25&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;to get started. And<u>&nbsp; 26&nbsp; </u>you find only three to four songs out of ten on a disc that you can <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;27&nbsp; </u>use.<br />\r\nWhen I told the owner of the shop about my <u>&nbsp;28&nbsp; </u>; he gave me a long thoughtful <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;29&nbsp; </u>. &ldquo;This means a lot to you, doesn&rsquo;t it?&rdquo; he said. &ldquo;Come with me.&rdquo;<br />\r\nHe led me <u>&nbsp;30 </u>&nbsp;the crowded shop and to a bench with a large professional karaoke box on it. He placed his large hand <u>&nbsp;31 </u>&nbsp;on his treasure and said, &ldquo;I have 800 karaoke songs in here. You can take your <u>&nbsp;32 </u>&nbsp;and I&rsquo;ll record them for you. That should get you started.&rdquo;<br />\r\nI <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;33&nbsp; </u>. Thanking him, I made a time with him to listen to all the songs and choose <u>&nbsp;34 </u>&nbsp;&nbsp;that I could sing. I have come full circle with his help.<br />\r\nHis <u>&nbsp;35 </u>&nbsp;still warms my heart and makes me do just that bit extra, when I have the chance.<br />\r\n16. A. loneliness &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. sadness&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. tiredness&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. sickness<br />\r\n17. A. more&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. the ones &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. few &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. the rest<br />\r\n35. A. courage &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. devotion &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. kindness &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. trust<br />\r\n<strong>III.</strong><strong>阅读理解</strong><strong>( </strong><strong>（共</strong><strong>20</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>40</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n第一节：(共15小题；每小题2分，满分30分)阅读下列材料，从每题所给的四个选项（A、B、C和D）中，选出最佳选项，并在答题纸上将该选项标号涂黑。<br />\r\nA<br />\r\n（2011安徽高考）They are the sort of friends who are so close they trust each other with their lives. If one falls, the other is there to catch him.<br />\r\nThey are Wellman, whose legs were permanently injured nine years ago in a rock-climbing accident, and Corbett, an experienced rock climber. Together, they climbed up Half Dome, the famous 2,000-foot rock in the Yosemite National Park, through one of the most difficult routes(路线).<br />\r\nDuring the climb, Corbett took the lead, hit in the metal spikes（尖状物）that guided the ropes and climbed up. Then, after Wellman pulled himself up the rope, Corbett went down to remove the spikes and climbed up again. This process was repeated time and again, inch by inch, for 13 days.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Wellman&rsquo;s job was not easy either. He got himself up the rope through upper body strength alone. In all, Wellman figured that he had done 5,000 pull-ups up the rope on the climb.&nbsp;<br />\r\nHowever, when the two men first met, they never talked about climbing. &ldquo;He knew that was how I got injured.&rdquo; Wellman said. Until one day Wellman decided that he wanted to climb again and they started training.<br />\r\nTheir climb of Half Dome was not all smooth. At one point, pieces of rock gave way, and Corbett dropped down quickly. Wellman locked their rope in place, stopping the fall at 20 feet. His quick action probably saved his friend&rsquo;s life.<br />\r\n&ldquo;Your partner can save your life &mdash; you can save your partner&rsquo;s life,&rdquo; Wellman said as the pair received congratulations from friends. &ldquo;There are real close ties.&rdquo;<br />\r\n36. Which of the following was a challenge for Corbett in climbing Half Dome?<br />\r\nA. To climb up to remove the spikes.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. To climb it twice<br />\r\nC. To do 5,000 pull-ups up the rope.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. To lock the rope in place.<br />\r\n37. Why did the two men never talk about climbing when they first met?<br />\r\nA. Corbett was poorly trained.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. Wellman had lost interest in climbing.<br />\r\nC. Corbett didn&rsquo;t want to hurt Wellman.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Wellman hadn&rsquo;t decided whether to climb again.<br />\r\n38. What do we know about Wellman?<br />\r\nA. He climbed Half Dome by himself.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. He was disabled in a traffic accident.<br />\r\nC. He stopped rock-climbing for some time.&nbsp;&nbsp; D. He was saved by Corbett during the climb.<br />\r\n39. The main idea of the text is that <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.</u><br />\r\nA. two heads are better than one&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. friendship is precious in life<br />\r\nC. the disabled should never give up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. a man can be destroyed but cannot be defeated<br />\r\nB<br />\r\nWhen you&rsquo;re lying on the white sands of the Mexican Riviera, the stresses(压力) of the world seem a million miles away. Hey, stop! This is no vacation-you have to finish something!<br />\r\nHere lies the problem for travel writer and food critic(评论家), Edie Jarolim &ldquo;I always loved traveling and always liked to eat, but it never occurred to me that I could make money doing both of those things,&rdquo; Jarolim said. Now you can read her travel advice everywhere in Arts and Antiques, in Brides, or in one of her three books, The Complete Idiot&rsquo;s Travel Guide to Mexican Beach Resorts.<br />\r\n&hellip;&hellip;writing began some eight years ago. After getting a PhD in English in Canada, she took a Test Frommer&rsquo;s travel guides, passed it, and got the job. After working at Frommer&rsquo;s, Jarolim worked for a while at Rough Guides in London, then Fodor&rsquo;s, where she fell so in love with a description of the Southwest of the U.S. that she moved there.<br />\r\nNow as a travel writer, she spends one-third of her year on the road. The rest of the time is spent completing her tasks and writing reviews of restaurants at home in Tucson, Arizona.<br />\r\nAs adventurous as the job sounds, the hard part is fact-checking all the information. Sure, it&rsquo;s great to write about a tourist attraction, but you&rsquo;d better get the local(当地的)museum hours correct or you could really ruin someone&rsquo;s vacation.<br />\r\n40. Which country does Jarolim live in now?<br />\r\nA．Mexico&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．The U.S.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C．The U.K.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．Canada<br />\r\n41. What is most difficult for Jarolim?<br />\r\nA．Working in different places to collect information&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nB．Checking all the facts to be written in the guides<br />\r\nC．Finishing her work as soon as possible&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nD．Passing a test to write travel guides<br />\r\n42. What do we know about Jarolim from the text?<br />\r\nA．She is successful in her job &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．She finds her life full of stresses<br />\r\nC．She spends half of her time traveling&nbsp; D．She is especially interested in museums<br />\r\n43. What would be the best title for the text?<br />\r\nA．Adventures in Travel Writing&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．Working as a Food Critic<br />\r\nC．Travel Guides on the Market&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．Vacationing for a Living<br />\r\nC<br />\r\n（2011 安徽高考）Think about the different ways that people use the wind. You can use it to fly a kite or to sail a boat. Wind is one of our cleanest and richest power sources（来源）, as well as one of the oldest. Evidence shows that windmills（风车）began to be used in ancient Iran back in the seventh century BC. They were first introduced to Europe during the 1100s, when armies returned from the Middle East with knowledge of using wind power.<br />\r\nFor many centuries, people used windmills to grind（磨碎）wheat into flour or pump water from deep underground. When electricity was discovered in the late 1800s, people living in remote areas began to use them to produce electricity. This allowed them to have electric lights and radio. However, by the 1940s, when electricity was available to people in almost all areas of the United States, windmills were rarely used.<br />\r\nDuring the 1970s, people started becoming concerned about the pollution that is created when coal and gas are burned to produce electricity. People also realized that the supply of coal and gas would not last forever. Then, wind was rediscovered, though it means higher costs. Today, there is a global movement to supply more and more of our electricity through the use of wind.<br />\r\n44. From the text we know that windmills<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; .</u><br />\r\nA. were invented by European armies&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nB. have a history of more than 2800 years<br />\r\nC. used to supply power to radio in remote areas&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nD. have rarely been used since electricity was discovered<br />\r\n45. What was a new use for wind power in the late l9th century?<br />\r\nA. Sailing a boat.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. Producing electricity.<br />\r\nC. Grinding wheat into flour.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Pumping water from underground.<br />\r\n46. One of the reasons wind was rediscovered in the 1970s is that<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.</u><br />\r\nA. wind power is cleaner&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. it is one of the oldest power sources<br />\r\nC. it was cheaper to create energy from wind&nbsp;&nbsp; D. the supply of coal and gas failed to meet needs<br />\r\n47. What would the author probably discuss in the paragraph that follows?<br />\r\nA. The advantage of wind power.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nB. The design of wind power plants.<br />\r\nC. The worldwide movement to save energy.&nbsp;<br />\r\nD. The global trend towards producing power from wind.<br />\r\nD<br />\r\nI hated dinner parties. But I decided to give them another<u> shot</u> because I&#39;m in London. And my friend Mallery invited me. And because dinner parties in London are very different from those back in New York. There, &#39;&ldquo;I&rsquo;m&nbsp; having a dinner party&#39; means: &quot;I&#39;m booking a table for 12 at a restaurant you can&#39;t afford and we&#39;ll be sharing the cheque evenly, no matter what you eat.&quot; Worse, in Manhattan there is always someone who leaves before the bill arrives. They&#39;ll throw down cash, half of what they owe, and then people like me, who don&rsquo;t drink, end up paying even more. But if I try to use the same trick, the hostess will shout: &quot;Where are you going?&quot; And it&#39;s not like I can say I have somewhere to go: everyone know I have nowhere to go.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But in London, dinner parties are in people&#39;s homes. Not only that, the guests are an interesting mix. The last time I went to one, the guests were from France, India. Denmark and Nigeria; it was like a gathering at the United Nations in New York. The mix is less striking. It&#39;s like a gathering at Bloomingdale&#39;s, a well-known department store.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For New Yorkers, talking about other parts of the world means Brooklyn and Queens in New York. But at Mallery&#39;s, when I said that I had been to Myanmar recently, people knew where it was. In New York people would think it was a usual new club<br />\r\n48. What does the word &quot;shot&quot; in Paragraph 1 probably mean?<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A. Choice.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. Try&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. Style.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Goal<br />\r\n49. What does the writer dislike most about dinner parties in New York?<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A There is a strange mix of people.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. The restaurants are expensive.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. The bill is not fairly shared.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. People have to pay cash<br />\r\n50. What does the author think of the parties in London?<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. A bit unusual&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．Full of tricks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C．Less costly.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D More interesting.<br />\r\n<strong>第二节</strong> <strong>（共</strong><strong>5</strong><strong>小题；每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n（<a href=\"http://www.yscbook.com/sjja/yingyu/test/goakmn/201203/525348.html\" target=\"_blank\">2012年焦作一模英语试题</a>）根据短文内容，从短文后的选项中选出能填入空白处的最佳选项。选项中有两项为多余选项。<br />\r\nMy daughter Chloe is starting out in college in the fall. With her newfound independence will come the newfound responsibilities of dealing with money. <u>&nbsp;51 </u>&nbsp;Now I have a few lessons I&rsquo;d like to share with Chloe, and with anyone else starting out in college.<br />\r\n<u>&nbsp;52 </u>&nbsp;OK, this is almost the only lesson you need. The biggest reason you get into money problems is that you spend money you don&rsquo;t really have. Then you end up in the hole, and it&rsquo;s hard to get out of the hole. You work too many hours to keep up with your spending. And you end up with a life that&rsquo;s about nothing but trying to pay for all the spending on something you don&rsquo;t really need. <u>&nbsp;53 </u><br />\r\nMake a very simple budget. It&rsquo;s a terrible thing for people who&rsquo;ve never done a budget, but it will become very simple and easy if you know how to do it. <u>&nbsp;54 </u>&nbsp;If the bills add up to more than the income, remove some bills.<br />\r\nPay bills right away. If you have the money, pay the bill as soon as it comes in. You can usually do this online, but if not, it&rsquo;s just a matter of writing a check, putting it in an envelope, and writing out an address &mdash; two minutes. <u>&nbsp;55 </u>&nbsp;If you let the bill-paying get pushed back, it becomes a terrible thing.<br />\r\nThat&rsquo;s all you need to know. If you save when you&rsquo;re in college, avoid debt, and pay bills on time, you&rsquo;re golden.<br />\r\nA. Why not enjoy your life in college?<br />\r\nB. Spend less than you earn.<br />\r\nC. So spend less, work less, worry less, be happier.<br />\r\nD. Like many young people, she hates thinking about money.<br />\r\nE. First, list your income, and then list your bills.<br />\r\nF. Find ways to get things done you need to get done.<br />\r\nG. Do this two-minute action at once, so you don&rsquo;t have to worry about it later.<br />\r\n<strong>卷</strong><strong>II (</strong><strong>共</strong><strong>35</strong><strong>分</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>IV</strong><strong>．阅读表达（共</strong><strong>5</strong><strong>小题；每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n<strong>（</strong><strong>2011</strong><strong>天津高考）阅读短文，并按照题目要求用英语回答问题。</strong><br />\r\nIn college, Spring Break （春假）is usually associated with the beach, parties and sleepless nights, bringing about relaxation, free time and friends. Students who wish to spend their break doing something productive and rewarding, however, may choose to participate in the Alternative Break Program. It places college students in communities both at home and abroad.<br />\r\nThe Program allows students to take part in various projects dealing with issues such as literacy （识字）, homelessness and the environment. It includes helping kids with their lessons, raising money for families in need and collecting data for environmental research.<br />\r\nThe hope is that, by getting themselves involved in different environments, students will have the opportunity to learn about members of communities and broaden their view. In turn, they will incorporate (融合) their experiences and lessons learned into their own communities. In a word, the Program aims to encourage students to be active citizens and engage themselves in making a difference in society.<br />\r\nIn the spring of 2006, about 36,000 students in the USA participated in the Alternative Break Program.<br />\r\nSamantha Giacobozzi, now director of the Program, has been on five alternative break trips herself, including trips to New Orleans, India and Dominican Republic. &ldquo;I was a student who went on alternative break trips and had my life totally <u>transformed</u> by that experience,&rdquo; she said. &ldquo;Every year, we meet many students who have attended the Program. You can see changes in their life that are connected with their alternative break experiences.&rdquo;<br />\r\nThe Program began in 1991.Today, it has become increasingly popular with college students in the United States.<br />\r\n56.Who may choose to participate in the Alternative Break Program?(No mare than 10 words)<br />\r\n57.What is the aim of the Program?(NO more than 15 words)<br />\r\n58.What is the meaning of the underlined word &quot;transformed&quot; in Paragraph 5? (1word)<br />\r\n59.What is Samantha&#39;s attitude toward the Program? (No more than 10 words)<br />\r\n60. If you take part in the Program, which project are you interested in? And why? (No more than 25 words)<br />\r\n<strong>V.</strong><strong>书面表达（满分</strong><strong>25</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; 假设你是李华。时下,你校不少学生带手机上学。为此,你班组织了一次班会，讨论中学生上学是否有必要带手机。请你给英语笔友Tom写封信，根据下表提供的信息，客观地介绍讨论的情况。可结合你校实际进行适当发挥，并发表自己的看法。<br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\">\r\n	<tbody>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 166px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">一些同学认为</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">一些同学认为</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 172px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">你的观点</span></td>\r\n		</tr>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 166px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">方便；时尚。</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">中学生自控能力差；玩手机浪费时间。</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 172px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">（请你实话实说）</span></td>\r\n		</tr>\r\n	</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">注意：</span><br />\r\n<ol>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">正确使用英文书信的基本格式。2. 词数：120左右。</span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<u>Dear </u><u>Tom,&nbsp; </u><br />\r\n<u>Recently we&rsquo;ve had a class meeting to discuss whether it is necessary for middle school students to carry mobile phones to school. &hellip;&nbsp;</u><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');

In dreams we do things which we would never do when we&#39;re awake. Why are dreams so strange and unfamiliar? Where do dreams come from?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; No one has produced a more <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;1&nbsp; &nbsp;</u>answer than a man called Sigmund Freud. When Freud was a child he cared about the <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;2 </u>&nbsp;of others, so it isn&#39;t<u>&nbsp;&nbsp; 3&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;that he became a doctor when he grew up. He learned all about the way in which the human body <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;4&nbsp; </u>. But he be came more and more <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;5&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;about the human mind.<br />\r\nAt that time it seemed that no one knew very much about the <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;6&nbsp; </u>. If a person went mad, or &quot;out of his mind&quot;, there was not much that could be done <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;7&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>it.<br />\r\nIn 1886 Freud began to work as a doctor in nerve (神经) diseases. Most of the<u>&nbsp;&nbsp; 8&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;who came to see him were women. They were over-excited and anxious, <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;9&nbsp;&nbsp; in mind rather than in body&nbsp; &nbsp;10&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;did not help them. Freud was full of sympathy (同情) but he could do<u>&nbsp; 11&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>to make them better.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nThen one day a friend, Dr Josef Breuer, told him about a girl he was <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;12&nbsp; </u>. The girl seemed to get <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;13&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;when she was allowed to talk about herself. She told Dr Breuer every thing that<u>&nbsp;&nbsp; 14&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;into her mind. And each time she talked to him she remembered more about her life as a little child.<br />\r\nFreud was <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;15&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;when he heard this. A British company, called electro&shy;texiles, has created a wide range of clothes&mdash;clothes that have minds of their own ! Scientists, working for the company, have invented a kind of fabric that can be mixed with flexible electronic materials to create intelligent clothing. The results are electronic garments.<br />\r\nIf you think the weather has to be wired to different devices, think again. These designer clothes are wire-free, soft to touch and washable! Like any electronic device, these high-tech clothes have to be powered. Currently, a tiny nine&shy;volt battery serves the purpose. But the researchers hope that in the near future the clothes will generate electricity by using body heat. These clothes are 100% shockproof, they say.<br />\r\nThe electro-texiles team has also created the world&#39;s first cloth keyboard. These keyboards can be sewn into your trousers or skirt. To use this device, you will have to sit down and tap on your lap! These &ldquo;lap tap&rdquo; devices are all set to take over laptop computers!<br />\r\nAnother useful garment is the shirt&shy;cum&shy;mobile phone. This handy invention enables drivers to chat comfortably with others at the wheel! Other popular electronic wears include the denim (牛仔布) jacket with flexible earphones sewn into the hoop and the electronic ski jacket with a built-in heater. The ski jacket is also programmed to send signals to a satellite. This technology is known as global positioning system and can be used to track lost skiers and wandering kids.<br />\r\nHaving completed the cloth keyboard, scientists have already started to work on a new project&mdash;a necktie that can be used as a computer mouse. What is the next? BCC buses operate from 5：30 am to 11：00 pm Monday to Thursday and 5：30 am to 12：00 am on Fridays. On weekends and public holidays buses operate less frequently. Pre&shy;paid bus tickets can be purchased from the QUT (Queensland University of Technology)bookshop，the campus news agency, most other news agencies and general stores，and any BCC Customer Service Centre. Short&shy;term students at QUT cannot use their ID cards to gain a discount fare on BCC public transport. You will need to buy an adult ticket to travel. Bus fares are dependent on the number of zones you have to travel. style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">Single：one way ticket to reach your destination，including transfers within 2 hours.<br />\r\nDaily: unlimited travel within the zones.<br />\r\nOff&shy;peak Daily：discounted unlimited travel between 9：00 am and 3：30 pm and after 7：00 pm<br />\r\nMonday to Friday，and all day on weekends and public holidays.<br />\r\nWeekly：unlimited travel within the zones for one week from the date of issue. Monthly：unlimited travel within the zones for one calendar month from the date of issue.<br />\r\nTen&shy;trip Saver: 10 trips at any time within the zones on buses and ferries only.<br />\r\nTransport routes，timetables and fare information are available from：<br />\r\nPublic Transport Information Centre<br />\r\n69 Ann Street (corner of George St)<br />\r\nBrisbane City<br />\r\nPhone 13 12 30(Transport Information Service)<br />\r\n44．The transport guide above is most likely provided by________.<br />\r\nA．Public Transport Information Centre&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．the Brisbane City Council<br />\r\nC．Queensland University of Technology.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D．BCC Customer Service Centres<br />\r\n45．We can learn from the passage that________.<br />\r\nA．buses are scheduled as usual on weekends and public holidays<br />\r\nB．regular students at QUT need to buy adult tickets<br />\r\nC．pre&shy;paid tickets can be bought from the Public Transport Information Centre<br />\r\nD．Ten&shy;trip Savers can be used at off-peak time<br />\r\n46．An exchange student staying at QUT for five days has to travel between zones every day. What type of ticket would he probably buy?<br />\r\nA．Single.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B．Weekly.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C．Off-peak Daily.&nbsp; &nbsp; D．Ten&shy;trip Saver.<br />\r\nD<br />\r\nWe&#39;ve all met with something that slows us down, for example, the bump(颠簸)in the road，the setback. You just have to keep in mind that a setback is only temporary and greater things lie ahead. Therefore, keep moving forward, developing what you have, since you&#39;ve already built a solid foundation on which you can rely.<br />\r\nIt is easy just to quit，give up and ignore the hard work you have put into something. But we believe in the &ldquo;two steps forward, one step back&rdquo; philosophy (哲学). So how can you react when something doesn&#39;t turn out as you&#39;ve expected it to be?<br />\r\nFirst，be objective. Step back and look at the situation. Is your setback really that significant，or will it just require a little extra effort? Then, plan your next move. You can ask for help. Don&#39;t be afraid or ashamed to do this. Frequently, people are more than willing to give you support and advice. You don&#39;t have to be perfect; after all, nobody else is. Next, bounce back. Reevaluate the goals you have set for yourself at the beginning and retool(改组) them as necessary. Goals should be realistic and specific, but that doesn&#39;t mean they can&#39;t be flexible. Instead of looking at your project as a disaster or a failure, view it with success. Concentrate on how great it will feel after it is finally done, after you have put your all into <u>it</u>. Instead of focusing on a possible unsatisfactory performance one single time, take a moment to sit back and reward yourself for all that you have accomplished.<br />\r\nAbove all，don&#39;t live with regrets. Success is never easy. It remains up to you whether you will give up, or fight through the tough battles to earn whatever you want. Keep reaching for your goals and you will achieve them. One small setback is nothing if you really want something and are willing to work for it.<br />\r\n47．According to the passage, the philosophy &ldquo;two steps forward, one step back&rdquo; means that&nbsp; ________ when meeting with a setback.<br />\r\nA. we are supposed to quit and ignore the hard work<br />\r\nB. we&#39;d better think it over before making a decision<br />\r\nC. we should stop to think before taking further action<br />\r\nD. we are expected to look at things in an all-round way<br />\r\n48．The underlined word &ldquo;it&rdquo; in Paragraph 3 refers to________.<br />\r\nA. a performance&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. a success&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. a goal&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. a project<br />\r\n49．When suffering a setback，the most important thing to do is________.<br />\r\nA. to keep moving forward to your goals<br />\r\nB. to depend on others&#39; support and advice<br />\r\nC. to sit back and reward yourself for your success<br />\r\nD. to focus on a possible unsatisfactory performance<br />\r\n50．What is the passage mainly about?<br />\r\nA. How to avoid the bumps.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. How to deal with the setbacks.<br />\r\nC. Different attitudes to the setbacks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Different suggestions on your goals.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n第二节 (共5小题；每小题2分，满分10分)<br />\r\n根据短文内容，从短文后的选项中选出能填入空白处的最佳选项。选项中有两项为多余选项。<br />\r\nShoppers who carefully plan their visit to the grocery store can save money on their grocery bills.&nbsp;&nbsp; <u>51 </u><br />\r\nShoppers should visit the grocery store on a full stomach by scheduling their trip immediately after a large meal. If that&#39;s not possible, they should find something healthy to eat while preparing a grocery list.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<u>&nbsp;52</u>__<br />\r\nAlthough having a list and sticking to it is the most important factor in saving money, shoppers&nbsp; must prepare lists wisely in order to save.&nbsp; &nbsp;__<u>53</u>_ Many special buys are announced through the local newspapers, so buying the &ldquo;grocery issue&rdquo; is worth the investment(投资). However, it&#39;s important to remember that many newer, more expensive products first offered through coupons may not yield enough savings for shoppers to give up the product they usually buy.<br />\r\n__<u>54</u>__ Once at the store, the shopper who wants to save money should follow a few more rules. The shopper should not stay longer than necessary，because bills go up each minute the shopper is in the store. So, setting a time limit and a cost limit can hold down the bill. _<u>_55_</u>_ If the grocery list is a short one，some shoppers choose to use the small hand&shy;held basket instead of the roomy grocery cart.<br />\r\nA. A carefully planned list should include in season produce and any items on sale or discounted through coupons (优惠券).<br />\r\nB. Of course, the shopper should stick strictly to the shopping list and resist the temptation to buy additional items.<br />\r\nC. People who are full are less tired and more likely to buy what they want.<br />\r\nD. Now that the shopper has completed the grocery list，it&#39;s time to leave for the store.<br />\r\nE. You should keep your shopping list carefully in case you can exchange it for coupons.<br />\r\nF. Most shoppers are less persuaded to buy extra goods when they are not hungry.<br />\r\nG. Shopping when not hungry, sticking to a grocery list，and following a few simple rules will cut down the grocery bill.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>卷</strong><strong>II (</strong><strong>共</strong><strong>35</strong><strong>分</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>IV.</strong><strong>阅读表达（共</strong><strong>5</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>10</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\nSpeaking of what sort of smartness is most desirable in human conduct, a friend of mine has this to say: Real smartness must be something that can be practised repeatedly and infinitely. Then, he goes on to relate this event: In one European country there resided some Lebanese. Upon learning that ambulance rides there are provided free to patients in emergency cases, they rented an apartment near a hospital. Each time they wanted to go home, they just pretended to be sick, calling for an ambulance. On arrival at the hospital, they said now that they felt much better and had no need of any treatment. The next moment saw them leaving, safe and sound, to their apartment.<br />\r\nTheir &ldquo;being-clever&rdquo; affords them only short-lived pleasure and joy; it could not be practised repeatedly, still less infinitely. Such smartness is based on &ldquo;too clever to be wise&rdquo;. Once seen through, they will lose the benefits they profited by playing dirty tricks. They will suffer the impairment of their own image and reputation as well as that of those who are tied with them by blood or by common interests.<br />\r\nWhen a person has done something to the discredit of one&#39;s own image and reputation, it will surely involve others related to him in one way or another. Among those inflicted most by what folly (愚蠢) he may have done are those who, to him, have been close in relations and dear in sentiment.<br />\r\nAdditionally, whether one&#39;s act is wise or unwise, rather the summit of wisdom, depends on the result of the act; if ________， then the more often he does it, the better will he be believed. <u>While repeating that act, he is not only earning himself an admirable image but also contributing to the fine impression and reputation of his relatives, his friends, his hometown and his motherland.</u><br />\r\n1. What does the passage mainly discuss? (no more than 10 words)<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n2. Please fill in the blank in the last paragraph with proper words. (no more than 10 words)<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n3. Which sentence in the passage can be replaced by the following one?<br />\r\nPeople that have ruined their own images not only hurt themselves but will involve their relatives or friends.<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n4. How would the telephone operators react to a Lebanese voice calling for an ambulance from then on? (no more than 10 words)<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n5. Translate the underlined sentence in the last paragraph into Chinese.<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>V.</strong><strong>书面表达（满分</strong><strong>25</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n你的英文老师让你准备一篇发言稿，就污染问题在英语课上谈谈你的看法。<br />\r\n要点如下：<br />\r\n1．工业污染的影响到处存在；<br />\r\n2．人口的持续增长；烟尘，化学废料产生的后果；<br />\r\n3．人们需要的是清洁的空气，安全的饮用水，孩子们的健康；<br />\r\n4．解决环境污染问题，不能只靠政府；<br />\r\n5．保护环境应从我做起。<br />\r\n注意：1. 词数120词左右(文章开头已给出)；<br />\r\n2. 可适当增加细节，以使行文连贯。<br />\r\nLadies and gentlemen，<br />\r\nYesterday our English teacher asked me to say something about pollution.Now, I give you my views on this vital question.<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n________________________________________________________________________<br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');
INSERT INTO `dede_cwez_addonarticle` VALUES('1366','37','<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<strong>人教版模块</strong><strong>5</strong><strong>单元测试参考答案</strong><br />\r\n<strong>Unit 1 Great Scientists</strong><br />\r\n<strong>基础测试卷</strong><strong>A</strong><br />\r\n<strong>I.</strong><strong>单词拼写</strong><br />\r\n1.cure 2.attend 3.contributed 4.absorb 5.blame 6.enthusiastic 7.cautious 8..neighborhood<br />\r\n9.pollution 10.construction<br />\r\n<strong>II.</strong><strong>短语翻译</strong><br />\r\n1.提出2.得出结论3.暴露于4.应受责备；应承担责任5.与......有联系6.为......做贡献7.除......之外8.对（某人）要求严格9.对......热心10.对......谨慎<br />\r\n<strong>III.</strong><strong>单项选择</strong><strong>1-5 AACAB 5-10 ADDCA 11-15 BAACB</strong><br />\r\n1.【答案】A【解析】put forward提出。put up张贴；put down放下，镇压；put off拖延。<br />\r\n2.【答案】A【解析】考查动词词义辨析。tell&ldquo;告诉&rdquo;；inform&ldquo;通知&rdquo;；promise&ldquo;答应&rdquo;，均不符合题意。announce的意思是&ldquo;公开地宣布&rdquo;，故选A。<br />\r\n3.【答案】C【解析】have sth.done让&hellip;&hellip;被&hellip;&hellip;。<br />\r\n4.【答案】A【解析】句意：假期要注意！喝酒太多会导致心脏病，造成高血压。contribute to导致，造成；relate to涉及，与&hellip;&hellip;相关；attend to照顾，处理；devote to把&hellip;&hellip;用于，致力于。<br />\r\n5.【答案】B【解析】attend to照顾，符合句意。refer to谈及；lead to导致；stick to坚持。<br />\r\n6.【答案】A【解析】考查动词短语辨析。句意：有时，梦是一种特殊的让你了解你的真实生活的机会，特别是当你被困于麻烦或压力中时。make sense of了解，理解；make use of利用；make up of组成，构成；make fun of取笑(某人)。<br />\r\n7.【答案】D【解析】expose sb.to sth.&ldquo;使某人接触某物/事&rdquo;，为固定搭配，符合句意：我认为让孩子们接触电视上的暴力行为和性行为几乎是一种犯罪。show后接双宾语；disclose&ldquo;揭露&rdquo;，uncover&ldquo;揭露&rdquo;均与题意不符。<br />\r\n8.【答案】D【解析】apart from除了&hellip;&hellip;，符合句意。rather than而不是；except for除了；owing to由于。<br />\r\n9.【答案】C【解析】be found doing被发现在干&hellip;&hellip;；be to blame该受责备。<br />\r\n10.【答案】A【解析】be absorbed in专心致志于。<br />\r\n12.【答案】B【解析】be strict with sb.in sth.对某人严格用with，对某事严格用in。<br />\r\n13.【答案】A【解析】cautious小心的，符合句意。curious好奇的；patient耐心的；enthusiastic热情的。<br />\r\n13.【答案】A【解析】reject拒绝。suspect怀疑；instruct【解析】；handle处理。<br />\r\n14.【答案】C【解析】a cure for一种&hellip;&hellip;的疗法；be cured of被治愈&hellip;&hellip;。<br />\r\n15.【答案】B【解析】suggest意为&ldquo;建议&rdquo;时，其后的宾语从句用虚拟语气，should do或should be done，should可以省略，该空与从句的主语具有被动关系，故B项正确。<br />\r\n<strong>V.</strong><strong>佳句翻译</strong><br />\r\n1.Who was it that put forward the theory of black hole?<br />\r\n2.Apart from some small faults,it was a perfect job.<br />\r\n3.His argument doesn&rsquo;t make any sense./His argument makes no sense.<br />\r\n4.Every time I added up these numbers,I got a different answer.<br />\r\n5.I can tell you about it only if you don&rsquo;t tell it to anybody else.<br />\r\n<strong>VI.</strong><strong>语法练习</strong><br />\r\n1-5 CACAA 6-10 DCAAB<br />\r\n<strong>VII.</strong><strong>完形填空</strong><br />\r\n1-5 ADBDA 6-10 CBADC 11-15 BADCB 16-20 DBACB<br />\r\n1【答案】A【解析】fill&ldquo;使充满；装满&rdquo;；visit&ldquo;参观；访问&rdquo;；attend&ldquo;参加&rdquo;；decorate&ldquo;装饰&rdquo;。由下文可知作者所经历到的事情是发生在一次学校的舞蹈表演上。孩子们的家庭成员都来看孩子们的舞蹈表演。由第一段所描述的内容来看，作者对此很期待。所以在这个大厅里，气氛热烈，家长们也都来了。故只有A项最符合语境。<br />\r\n2.【答案】D【解析】pressure&ldquo;压力&rdquo;；impression&ldquo;印象&rdquo;；debate&ldquo;辩论&rdquo;；attention&ldquo;关注；注意&rdquo;。句意为&ldquo;我是一个只有七岁的小女孩，但是我是大家关注的中心&rdquo;。作者在此要表达的意思就是：我虽然年纪小，但却是舞蹈表演的核心队员，这让她感到很自豪。由语境可知，D项最恰当。<br />\r\n3.【答案】B【解析】take over&ldquo;接管；接受&rdquo;；show off&ldquo;卖弄；炫耀&rdquo;；look after&ldquo;照顾&rdquo;；give up&ldquo;放弃&rdquo;。句意为&ldquo;最后，经过多周的准备之后，在这次舞蹈表演中我将会把我辛苦的锻炼表现出来&rdquo;。故只有B项最合适。<br />\r\n4.【答案】D【解析】reasonable&ldquo;合情合理的&rdquo;；suitable&ldquo;合适的；适当的&rdquo;；obvious&ldquo;显而易见的&rdquo;；perfect&ldquo;完美的；最好的&rdquo;。由常识可知，我准备的这么充分，当然会认为一切都会非常完美。故D项符合语境。<br />\r\n5.【答案】A【解析】dress up&ldquo;打扮；穿上盛装；打扮得很漂亮&rdquo;；fold up&ldquo;垮台；放弃&rdquo;；cover up&ldquo;掩盖；盖住&rdquo;；mix up&ldquo;拌和；调和&rdquo;。句意为&ldquo;我等在后台，穿着黑色的带有金色腰带的紧身衣&rdquo;。由in my black tights with a golden belt可知，这是为了表演特意穿上的，是为了让自己打扮得更漂亮，所以只有dress up符合文意。<br />\r\n6.【答案】C【解析】suggest&ldquo;建议&rdquo;；explain&ldquo;解释&rdquo;；announce&ldquo;宣布&rdquo;；predict&ldquo;预言；预知&rdquo;。由常识可知，节目的表演顺序要由主持人来宣布。故C项正确。<br />\r\n7.【答案】B【解析】music&ldquo;音乐&rdquo;；audience&ldquo;观众&rdquo;；curtain&ldquo;幕；窗帘&rdquo;；stage&ldquo;舞台&rdquo;。由常识可知，演员表演节目要面对观众。故B项正确。<br />\r\n8.【答案】A【解析】easy&ldquo;容易的&rdquo;；active&ldquo;活跃的；积极的&rdquo;；adventurous&ldquo;大胆的；爱冒险的&rdquo;；extra&ldquo;额外的&rdquo;。由下文我的注意力集中在面带微笑和挺胸抬头上，证明这种脚步的移动很简单，很容易。故A项符合语境。<br />\r\n9.【答案】D【解析】contain&ldquo;容纳；包含&rdquo;；hide&ldquo;隐藏；隐瞒&rdquo;；share&ldquo;分享&rdquo;；keep&ldquo;保持&rdquo;。由常识可知，表演者要让自己始终面带微笑。故D项正确。<br />\r\n10.【答案】C【解析】why&ldquo;为什么&rdquo;；whether&ldquo;是否&rdquo;；where&ldquo;在&hellip;&hellip;的地方；在哪里&rdquo;；what&ldquo;什么&rdquo;。由下文的&ldquo;I missed my partner&#39;s box...&rdquo;可知，此处是指我没有注意到我走到哪里了。故C项符合语境。<br />\r\n11.【答案】B【解析】wander&ldquo;徘徊&rdquo;；slip&ldquo;滑过；滑倒&rdquo;；wave&ldquo;挥手；摇动&rdquo;；skip&ldquo;遗漏；跳过&rdquo;。根据下文的内容描述以及最后一段的最后一句&ldquo;Now when friends and family laugh about the time I slipped during a dance performance，I can laugh too.&rdquo;可知，此处B项最符合语境。<br />\r\n12.【答案】A【解析】blood&ldquo;血液&rdquo;；pleasure&ldquo;快乐；娱乐&rdquo;；pride&ldquo;自豪；骄傲&rdquo;；tear&ldquo;眼泪&rdquo;。由常识可知，我在表演时从箱子上滑了下来，观众又咯咯地笑起来，我肯定会感到很尴尬，所以应该是血液上涌，我的脸红了。故A项符合语境。<br />\r\n13.【答案】D【解析】leave&ldquo;离开&rdquo;；cheer&ldquo;欢呼；为&hellip;&hellip;加油&rdquo;；believe&ldquo;相信；认为&rdquo;；notice&ldquo;引起注意；注意到&rdquo;。句意为&ldquo;我记起了舞蹈老师告诉我们的话。&lsquo;如果你出了错，那么保持面带微笑吧。因为这样观众不会注意到你出了错&rsquo;。&rdquo;由句意可知，D项正确。<br />\r\n14.【答案】C【解析】gesture&ldquo;姿态；手势&rdquo;；example&ldquo;例子；榜样&rdquo;；advice&ldquo;建议&rdquo;；plan&ldquo;计划&rdquo;。由上下文可知，我尽力接受她的建议。follow one&#39;s advice&ldquo;接受某人的建议&rdquo;，固定短语。<br />\r\n15.【答案】B【解析】doubt&ldquo;怀疑&rdquo;；hope&ldquo;希望&rdquo;；voice&ldquo;声音；嗓音&rdquo;；patience&ldquo;耐心&rdquo;。根据第一段的&ldquo;I was only a 7&shy;year&shy;old girl but I was the center of attention.Finally，after weeks of preparation，I would show off all my hard work in a dance performance.&rdquo;以及&ldquo;Everything would be perfect&mdash;so I thought.&rdquo;可推断出，我对这次表演充满了希望。但是由于我从箱子上滑了下来，所以当谢幕的时候，我所有的希望也随之破灭了。故只有B项符合语境。<br />\r\n16.【答案】D【解析】argue&ldquo;争论；辩论&rdquo;；shout&ldquo;喊叫&rdquo;；beg&ldquo;乞求&rdquo;；sob&ldquo;呜咽；啜泣&rdquo;。由下文的&ldquo;tasting the salt from the tears that streamed down my face&rdquo;可知，此处sob符合语境。<br />\r\n17.【答案】B【解析】turn down&ldquo;减小；关小；拒绝&rdquo;；calm down&ldquo;平静下来；镇静下来&rdquo;；let down&ldquo;使失望；辜负&rdquo;；put down&ldquo;放下；写下&rdquo;。我哭着跑向后台，情绪很激动，没人能够让我平静下来。故B项符合文意。<br />\r\n18.【答案】A【解析】star&ldquo;星星；明星&rdquo;；pioneer&ldquo;先锋&rdquo;；loser&ldquo;失败者；遗失者&rdquo;；fool&ldquo;傻子&rdquo;。由下文的&ldquo;I was________，but I fought the urge to run off the stage.________，I finished the routine with a smile on my face&rdquo;可知，虽然我从箱子上滑了下来，但是我并没有跑下台，而是坚持面带微笑表演完了节目，所以在这之后我才意识到自己是那晚的明星。<br />\r\n19.【答案】C【解析】satisfied&ldquo;满意的&rdquo;；moved&ldquo;感动的&rdquo;；embarrassed&ldquo;尴尬的&rdquo;；confused&ldquo;困惑的&rdquo;。由常识可知，在表演的时候从箱子上掉下来，当然感到尴尬了。所以C项符合文意。<br />\r\n20.【答案】B【解析】however&ldquo;然而；可是；无论如何&rdquo;；instead&ldquo;反而；代替&rdquo;；in total&ldquo;总计&rdquo;；in return&ldquo;作为回报&rdquo;。句意为&ldquo;我很尴尬，但是我克服了想跑下台的想法，反而是留在了台上，面带微笑结束了我们的常规节目&rdquo;。由上下文可知，此处B项最符合语境。<br />\r\n<strong>VIII.</strong><strong>阅读理解</strong><br />\r\n1-5 BDCBA<br />\r\n1.B。细节题。根据第2段第2句话Up till now,it&rsquo;s believed that an explosion in the torpedo compartment in the nose of the Kursk was the likely cause可知答案。<br />\r\n2.D。细节题。根据第1段倒数第2句话&hellip;Northern Fleet Commander Admiral Vyachesav Popov ordered rescue ships into the area可知答案。<br />\r\n3.C。判断题。根据第2段倒数第2句话But Russian insisted that only Russians work inside the submarine Kursk可得出答案。<br />\r\n4.B。判断题。此题属考查考生的国际军事外交常识。其中四个选项文章中均没有提及到，但比较四个选项可以发现C选项较合情理(潜核艇内部设备属于国家机密，不允许别国的人入内，以免泄密)。<br />\r\n5.A。词义猜测题。从第1段后部分内容中可猜出是the naval command与submarine Kurst&ldquo;失去联系&rdquo;后，Northern Fleet Commander估计submarine Kurst发生了事故，才派遣搜救船队。<br />\r\n<strong>能力提升卷</strong><strong>B</strong><br />\r\n<strong>卷</strong><strong>I </strong><br />\r\n<strong>I.</strong><strong>单项填空（共</strong><strong>15</strong><strong>小题，每小题</strong><strong>1</strong><strong>分，满分</strong><strong>15</strong><strong>分）</strong><br />\r\n1-5 BCAAB 6-10 BADDC 11-15 CDBBD<br />\r\n1.解析:选B。根据句意，此句应表示&ldquo;提出一个新的治疗方案&rdquo;。Come about发生；speak up大声说出；regard as把&hellip;&hellip;当作。<br />\r\n2.解析：选C。attend参加，后多跟school，class，meeting，lecture；join表示参加某一组织或团体；attend to表示&ldquo;料理&rdquo;。故选C。<br />\r\n3.解析：选A。句意为：我觉得你丈夫应受责备，他宠坏了孩子。be to blame没有被动形式。<br />\r\n4.解析：选A。the moment在此相当于连词，引导一个时间状语从句，意为&ldquo;一&hellip;&hellip;就&hellip;&hellip;&rdquo;。<br />\r\n5.解析：选B。declare多指正式场合宣布官方的立场或态度，主语多为人或机构；predict意为&ldquo;预测&rdquo;；publish指以口头或印刷品的方式让群众知道，多指后者；announce除表示&ldquo;宣布，宣告&rdquo;之外，还可用于抽象意义，意为&ldquo;显示，预示&rdquo;，主语为事物。故选B。<br
